Name: Mummy of a bird
Description: This mummy of anthropomorphic aspect first was part of the collection of Cardinal Lambruschini and then of the collection of É. de Meester de Ravestein. It looks like a human mummy in miniature, characterised by thick hair made of cords. X-Rays demonstrate the presence, in the thoracic part, of the skeleton of a small bird with a long beak. The identification of the animal is not certain. It is probable that the piece in its present state is of modern construction, comprising an antique bird mummy.
